codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceCategory
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceCategory
codeSystems.description: Category of an identified substance associated with allergies or intolerances.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
codeSystems.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceType
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceType
codeSystems.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk.

codeSystems.name: EventStatus
codeSystems.title: EventStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an event.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
codeSystems.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).
codeSystems.http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-allergyi: AllergyIntolerance Substance/Product, Condition and Negation Codes

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceVerificationStatus
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntolerance Verification Status
codeSystems.description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

codeSystems.name: ProviderRole
codeSystems.title: providerRole
codeSystems.description: Code system of concepts specifying the functional involvement with the activity being transmitted (e.g., Case Manager, Evaluator, Transcriber, Nurse Care Practitioner, Midwife, Physician Assistant, etc.).  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the ROL segment.

codeSystems.name: ActReason
codeSystems.title: ActReason
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an Act, when such rationale is not reasonably represented as an ActRelationship of type "has reason" linking to another Act.

*Examples:* Example reasons that might qualify for being coded in this field might be: "routine requirement", "infectious disease reporting requirement", "on patient request", "required by law".

codeSystems.name: ActSite
codeSystems.title: ActSite
codeSystems.description: An anatomical location on an organism which can be the focus of an act.
codeSystems.http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-immuniza: Codes for Immunization Site of Administration

codeSystems.name: RouteOfAdministration
codeSystems.title: RouteOfAdministration
codeSystems.description: The path the administered medication takes to get into the body or into contact with the body.

codeSystems.name: NGClinicalStatusCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Adverse Event Clinical Status CS
codeSystems.description: A classification system that represents the current clinical status of an individual who experienced an Adverse Event Following Immunization (AEFI), based on medical observation, investigation, or follow-up assessment.

codeSystems.name: NGFacilityTypeCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Facility Type CS
codeSystems.description: A standardized classification system used to describe the type or level of health facility within a healthcare delivery system, based on the scope of services provided, staffing, infrastructure, and administrative role.

codeSystems.name: NGGenderCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Gender CS
codeSystems.description: The administrative gender of a person.

codeSystems.name: NGHivStatusCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Client HIV status CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines list of options for HIV status of a Client

codeSystems.name: NGImmunizationContraindicationCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Vaccine contraindications CS
codeSystems.description: A set of standardized codes used to represent clinical conditions, diagnoses, or circumstances that serve as contraindications to the administration of one or more vaccines.

codeSystems.name: NGImmunizationSessionTypeCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Immunization Session types CS
codeSystems.description: Type of session for immunization. Could be in a fixed facility, outreach or mobile.

codeSystems.name: NGLanguagesCS
codeSystems.title: NGâ€‘Imm Languages in Nigeria CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines codes for major languages spoken across Nigeria.

codeSystems.name: NGLGAsCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm LGAs in Nigeria CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines LGA codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.

codeSystems.name: NGOrganizationOwnerCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Location Owner CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines Immunization Location Owner.

codeSystems.name: NGPregnancyStatusCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Client Pregnancy status CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines list of options for Pregnancy status of a Client

codeSystems.name: NGRelationshipsCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Relationships CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines list of persons related to a patient, but who is not a direct target of care

codeSystems.name: NGSiblingHealthStatusCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Sibling Health Status CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines the health of the client's sibling

codeSystems.name: NGStatesCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm States in Nigeria CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.

codeSystems.name: NGVaccineLibraryCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Vaccine Library with SNOMED CT codes
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem for IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library Data Elements supported by this IG using SNOMED CT codes

codeSystems.name: NGWardsCS
codeSystems.title: NG-Imm Administrative Wards CS
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective Local Government Areas (LGAs) in Nigeria.
